# List of Olympic Games host cities

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

Jump to: navigation, search

This is a list of host cities of the Olympic Games, both summer and winter,
since the [modern Olympics](/wiki/Modern_Olympics "Modern Olympics") began in
1896. Since then, summer games have usually – but not always – celebrated a
four-year period known as an Olympiad. There have been 28 [Summer Olympic
Games](/wiki/Summer_Olympic_Games "Summer Olympic Games") held in 24 cities,
and 23 [Winter Olympic Games](/wiki/Winter_Olympic_Games "Winter Olympic
Games") held in 20 cities. In addition, three summer and two winter editions
of the Games were scheduled to take place but later cancelled due to war:
[Berlin](/wiki/Berlin "Berlin") (summer) in 1916; [Tokyo](/wiki/Tokyo
"Tokyo")/[Helsinki](/wiki/Helsinki "Helsinki") (summer) and
[Sapporo](/wiki/Sapporo "Sapporo")/[Garmisch-Partenkirchen](/wiki/Garmisch-
Partenkirchen "Garmisch-Partenkirchen") (winter) in 1940; and
[London](/wiki/London "London") (summer) and [Cortina d'Ampezzo,
Italy](/wiki/Cortina_d%27Ampezzo,_Italy "Cortina d'Ampezzo, Italy") (winter)
in 1944. The [1906 Summer Olympics](/wiki/1906_Intercalated_Games "1906
Intercalated Games") were officially sanctioned and held in
[Athens](/wiki/Athens "Athens"). However, in 1949, the [International Olympic
Committee](/wiki/International_Olympic_Committee "International Olympic
Committee") (IOC), decided to unrecognize the 1906 Games.[1] Four cities have
been chosen by the IOC to host upcoming Olympic Games: [Tokyo](/wiki/Tokyo
"Tokyo") for the [2020 Summer Olympics](/wiki/2020_Summer_Olympics "2020
Summer Olympics"), [Beijing](/wiki/Beijing "Beijing") for the [2022 Winter
Olympics](/wiki/2022_Winter_Olympics "2022 Winter Olympics"),
[Paris](/wiki/Paris "Paris") for the [2024 Summer
Olympics](/wiki/2024_Summer_Olympics "2024 Summer Olympics"), and [Los
Angeles](/wiki/Los_Angeles "Los Angeles") for the [2028 Summer
Olympics](/wiki/2028_Summer_Olympics "2028 Summer Olympics").

In 2022, Beijing will become the only city that has held both the summer and
the winter Olympic Games. Nine cities will have hosted the Olympic Games more
than once: Athens ([1896](/wiki/1896_Summer_Olympics "1896 Summer Olympics")
and [2004 Summer Olympics](/wiki/2004_Summer_Olympics "2004 Summer
Olympics")), [Paris](/wiki/Paris "Paris") ([1900](/wiki/1900_Summer_Olympics
"1900 Summer Olympics"), [1924](/wiki/1924_Summer_Olympics "1924 Summer
Olympics") and [2024 Summer Olympics](/wiki/2024_Summer_Olympics "2024 Summer
Olympics")), London ([1908](/wiki/1908_Summer_Olympics "1908 Summer
Olympics"), [1948](/wiki/1948_Summer_Olympics "1948 Summer Olympics") and
[2012 Summer Olympics](/wiki/2012_Summer_Olympics "2012 Summer Olympics")),
[St. Moritz](/wiki/St._Moritz "St. Moritz") ([1928](/wiki/1928_Winter_Olympics
"1928 Winter Olympics") and [1948 Winter Olympics](/wiki/1948_Winter_Olympics
"1948 Winter Olympics")), [Lake Placid](/wiki/Lake_Placid,_New_York "Lake
Placid, New York") ([1932](/wiki/1932_Winter_Olympics "1932 Winter Olympics")
and [1980 Winter Olympics](/wiki/1980_Winter_Olympics "1980 Winter
Olympics")), [Los Angeles](/wiki/Los_Angeles "Los Angeles")
([1932](/wiki/1932_Summer_Olympics "1932 Summer Olympics"),
[1984](/wiki/1984_Summer_Olympics "1984 Summer Olympics") and [2028 Summer
Olympics](/wiki/2028_Summer_Olympics "2028 Summer Olympics")),
[Innsbruck](/wiki/Innsbruck "Innsbruck") ([1964](/wiki/1964_Winter_Olympics
"1964 Winter Olympics") and [1976 Winter Olympics](/wiki/1976_Winter_Olympics
"1976 Winter Olympics")), [Tokyo](/wiki/Tokyo "Tokyo")
([1964](/wiki/1964_Summer_Olympics "1964 Summer Olympics") and [2020 Summer
Olympics](/wiki/2020_Summer_Olympics "2020 Summer Olympics")) and
[Beijing](/wiki/Beijing "Beijing") ([2008 Summer
Olympics](/wiki/2008_Summer_Olympics "2008 Summer Olympics") and [2022 Winter
Olympics](/wiki/2022_Winter_Olympics "2022 Winter Olympics")). In addition,
[Stockholm](/wiki/Stockholm "Stockholm") hosted the [1912 Summer
Olympics](/wiki/1912_Summer_Olympics "1912 Summer Olympics") and the
equestrian portion of the [1956 Summer Olympics](/wiki/1956_Summer_Olympics
"1956 Summer Olympics").[d] London became the first city to have hosted three
Games with the 2012 Summer Olympics. Paris will become the second city to do
this with the 2024 Summer Olympics, followed by Los Angeles as the third in
2028. The [United States](/wiki/United_States "United States") has hosted a
total of eight Olympic Games, more than any other country, followed by
[France](/wiki/France "France") with five editions. [Canada](/wiki/Canada
"Canada"), [Germany](/wiki/Germany "Germany"), [Italy](/wiki/Italy "Italy"),
[Japan](/wiki/Japan "Japan"), and the [United Kingdom](/wiki/United_Kingdom
"United Kingdom") have each hosted three Games.

The Games have primarily been hosted in the continents of
[Europe](/wiki/Europe "Europe") (36 editions) and [North
America](/wiki/North_America "North America") (12 editions); eight Games have
been hosted in [Asia](/wiki/Asia "Asia") and two have been hosted in
[Oceania](/wiki/Oceania "Oceania"). In 2016, Rio de Janeiro became [South
America](/wiki/South_America "South America")'s first Olympic host city, while
the [African](/wiki/Africa "Africa") continent has yet to hold the Games.
Other major geographic regions which have never hosted the Olympics include
the [Middle East](/wiki/Middle_East "Middle East"), the [Indian
subcontinent](/wiki/Indian_subcontinent "Indian subcontinent"), the
[Caribbean](/wiki/Caribbean "Caribbean"), and [Southeast
Asia](/wiki/Southeast_Asia "Southeast Asia").

Host cities are selected by the IOC membership, usually seven years in
advance.[2] The selection process lasts approximately two years. In the first
stage, any city in the world may submit an application to become a host city.
After 10 months, the Executive Board of the IOC decides which applicant city
will become official candidates as based on the recommendation of a working
group that reviews the applications. In a second stage, the candidate cities
are investigated thoroughly by an Evaluation Commission, which then submits a
final short list of cities to be considered for selection. The host city is
then chosen by vote of the [IOC session](/wiki/List_of_IOC_meetings "List of
IOC meetings"), a general meeting of IOC members.[3]

##
Notes[[edit](/w/index.php?title=List_of_Olympic_Games_host_cities&action=edit&section=7
"Edit section: Notes")]

  * **a** Originally awarded to [Chicago](/wiki/Chicago "Chicago"), but moved to [St. Louis](/wiki/St._Louis,_Missouri "St. Louis, Missouri") to coincide with the [World's Fair](/wiki/Louisiana_Purchase_Exposition "Louisiana Purchase Exposition").[14][15]
  * **b** The 1906 Games were sanctioned and treated as an Olympic Games when held, and they were recognized as an Olympic Games by the IOC until 1949[16]
  * **c** The 1908 Games were originally given to [Rome](/wiki/Rome "Rome"), but were moved to London when [Mount Vesuvius](/wiki/Mount_Vesuvius "Mount Vesuvius") erupted.[17]
  * **d** The [sailing events](/wiki/Sailing_at_the_1920_Summer_Olympics "Sailing at the 1920 Summer Olympics") in 1920 were held in Ostend, [Belgium](/wiki/Belgium "Belgium") and in Amsterdam, [Netherlands](/wiki/Netherlands "Netherlands").
  * **e** The 1940 winter games were originally awarded to [Sapporo](/wiki/Sapporo "Sapporo"), but were moved to [Garmisch-Partenkirchen](/wiki/Garmisch-Partenkirchen "Garmisch-Partenkirchen") before being cancelled.
  * **f** The 1940 summer games were originally awarded to [Tokyo](/wiki/Tokyo "Tokyo"), but were moved to [Helsinki](/wiki/Helsinki "Helsinki") before being cancelled.
  * **g** [Equestrian](/wiki/Equestrianism "Equestrianism") events were held in [Stockholm](/wiki/Stockholm "Stockholm"), [Sweden](/wiki/Sweden "Sweden"). Stockholm had to bid for the equestrian competition separately; it received its own Olympic flame and had its own formal invitations and opening and closing ceremonies, just like the regular Summer Olympics.[18]
  * **h** [Russia](/wiki/Russia "Russia")/[Soviet Union](/wiki/Soviet_Union "Soviet Union") spans the continents of [Europe](/wiki/Europe "Europe") and [Asia](/wiki/Asia "Asia"). However, the Russian [National Olympic Committee](/wiki/National_Olympic_Committee "National Olympic Committee") is part of the [European Olympic Committees](/wiki/European_Olympic_Committees "European Olympic Committees"). Also, [Moscow](/wiki/Moscow "Moscow") is on the European side of the most commonly recognized [boundary between Europe and Asia](/wiki/Boundaries_between_continents#Europe_and_Asia "Boundaries between continents"). ([Sochi](/wiki/Sochi "Sochi") is in Asia per the usual geographic boundary, being just south of the [Greater Caucasus](/wiki/Greater_Caucasus "Greater Caucasus")' western end; but political approximations of the continental boundary place it in Europe.)
  * **i** [Equestrian](/wiki/Equestrianism "Equestrianism") events were held in China's [Hong Kong SAR](/wiki/Hong_Kong "Hong Kong").[19] Although Hong Kong's separate NOC conducted the equestrian competition, it was an integral part of the Beijing Games (unlike the 1956 Stockholm equestrian competition it was not conducted under a separate Hong Kong bid, separate flame, etc.).[20]
